docs.title: Welcome to PixelStudio
docs.text: A full-featured pixel art application built with Godot 4.x - an open source alternative to Aseprite.

docs.title: 🎨 What is PixelStudio?
docs.text: PixelStudio is a comprehensive pixel art creation tool designed for artists, game developers, and hobbyists. Built on the powerful Godot 4.x engine, it provides all the essential features you need for creating beautiful pixel art and animations.

docs.title: Drawing Tools
docs.text: A complete set of drawing tools including pencil, eraser, fill bucket, line tool, shapes, and more.

docs.title: Layer Management
docs.text: Professional layer system with opacity controls, blending modes, and organizational features.

docs.title: Animation
docs.text: Frame-by-frame animation with timeline, onion skinning, and real-time playback.

docs.title: Color Palettes
docs.text: Powerful palette management system for creating, editing, importing, and exporting color schemes.

docs.title: Export Options
docs.text: Export your work in multiple formats including PNG, GIF, and sprite sheets.

docs.title: 🚀 Quick Start
docs.text: Ready to get started? Check out our Installation Guide or jump straight to the Quick Start Tutorial.

docs.title: 🤝 Contributing
docs.text: PixelStudio is open source and we welcome contributions! See our Contributing Guide to learn how you can help.

docs.title: 📋 Project Status

docs.title: Minimum
docs.text:
• OS: Windows 10, macOS 10.13, Ubuntu 20.04 or equivalent
  • Processor: x64 architecture, 2 GHz dual-core
  • Memory: 2 GB RAM
  • Graphics: OpenGL 3.3 compatible
  • Storage: 200 MB available space

docs.title: Recommended
docs.text:
• OS: Windows 11, macOS 13, Ubuntu 22.04 or equivalent
  • Processor: x64 architecture, 3 GHz quad-core
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Dedicated GPU with OpenGL 3.3+
  • Storage: 500 MB available space

docs.title: Quick Start
docs.text:
!!! info "Under Development" This guide will be expanded as features are implemented.

Get started with PixelStudio in just a few minutes!

docs.title: Creating Your First Canvas
docs.text:
1. Launch PixelStudio
  2. Click File → New or press Ctrl+N (Windows/Linux) or Cmd+N (macOS)
  3. Set your canvas size:
  4. Width: 32 pixels
  5. Height: 32 pixels
  6. Click Create

docs.title: Drawing Your First Pixels
docs.text:
1. Select the Pencil Tool from the toolbar or press P
  2. Choose a color from the palette panel
  3. Click and drag on the canvas to draw
  4. Use the Eraser Tool (E) to remove pixels

docs.title: Working with Layers
docs.text:
1. Open the Layers Panel (usually on the right side)
  2. Click the New Layer button
  3. Name your layer and click OK
  4. Draw on the new layer - notice it appears above the previous layer

docs.title: Creating a Simple Animation
docs.text:
1. Open the Timeline Panel (usually at the bottom)
  2. Click New Frame to add a second frame
  3. Make small changes to your drawing
  4. Press Play to see your animation!

docs.title: Exporting Your Work
docs.text:
1. Click File → Export
  2. Choose your export format:
  3. PNG: Single image
  4. GIF: Animated image
  5. Sprite Sheet: All frames in a grid
  6. Select your destination and click Export

docs.title: Tips for Beginners
docs.text:
!!! tip "Zoom In" Use the mouse wheel or +/- keys to zoom in and out. Pixel art is easier when you're zoomed in!

!!! tip "Onion Skinning" Enable onion skinning in the Timeline panel to see previous/next frames while animating.

!!! tip "Color Palettes" Start with a limited color palette (like 4-8 colors) for a cohesive look.

!!! tip "Save Often" Press Ctrl+S (Windows/Linux) or Cmd+S (macOS) frequently to save your work.
